content: American political commentatorThis biography of a living person **relies too much on references to primary sources**. Please help by adding secondary or tertiary sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately**, especially if potentially libelous or harmful. *Find sources:* "Harry Sisson" influencer – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Harry J. Sisson** is a [liberal](/wiki/Modern_liberalism_in_the_United_States) political commentator and social media influencer based in the United States. He is known for producing political videos on [TikTok](/wiki/TikTok) and other platforms, frequently expressing support for [Democratic Party](/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) policies and candidates including former President [Joe Biden](/wiki/Joe_Biden) and former Vice President [Kamala Harris](/wiki/Kamala_Harris). His videos are often aimed at engaging young voters and discussing current events from a liberal perspective. ## Early life Sisson was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to American parents. He spent parts of his childhood in [Dubai](/wiki/Dubai) and [Dublin](/wiki/Dublin), where he attended school. He holds [dual citizenship](/wiki/Multiple_citizenship) in the [United States](/wiki/Citizenship_of_the_United_States#Naturalized_citizenship) and [Ireland](/wiki/Irish_nationality_law). Sisson moved to the United States at age 14 and resides in New York City, where he studies politics and law at [New York University](/wiki/New_York_University). ## Career Part of a series on[Modern Liberalism in the United States](/wiki/Modern_liberalism_in_the_United_States)History - [The New Freedom](/wiki/The_New_Freedom) - [New Deal](/wiki/New_Deal) - [Fair Deal](/wiki/Fair_Deal) - [New Frontier](/wiki/New_Frontier) - [Great Society](/wiki/Great_Society) - [Affordable Care Act](/wiki/Affordable_Care_Act) - *[The Problem with Jon Stewart](/wiki/The_Problem_with_Jon_Stewart)* See also - [Civil rights movements](/wiki/Civil_rights_movements) - [Liberalism in the United States](/wiki/Liberalism_in_the_United_States) - *[Woke](/wiki/Woke)* - Liberalism portal - United States portal - v - t - e Sisson began posting about [American politics](/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_States) during the [2016 U.S. presidential election](/wiki/2016_U.S._presidential_election) while living abroad in Europe, using the username @typical_democrat. He gained a following on [TikTok](/wiki/TikTok) in 2020 after posting videos supporting then-presidential candidate [Joe Biden](/wiki/Joe_Biden). His content includes political commentary and reactions to news, often from a Democratic perspective. In the lead-up to the [2024 U.S. presidential election](/wiki/2024_U.S._presidential_election), Sisson's follower count grew, and his content became more widely circulated. [Federal Election Commission](/wiki/Federal_Election_Commission) filings show that liberal [PAC](/wiki/Political_action_committees) Democracy Defense Action (including as its previous incarnation [MeidasTouch](/wiki/MeidasTouch)) had paid Sisson several times for his social media consulting. ### Political views and comments Sisson has expressed support for [Democratic Party](/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)) policies, including healthcare expansion, climate legislation, gun control, [LGBTQ rights](/wiki/LGBTQ_rights_in_the_United_States), immigration, and [student loan](/wiki/Student_loans_in_the_United_States) forgiveness. He has also voiced opposition to state-level library refusals and endorsed continued [U.S. support for Ukraine](/wiki/United_States_and_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine). He voiced support for [Emanuel Macron](/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron) in the [2022 French presidential election](/wiki/2022_French_presidential_election). When the [Supreme Court](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States) unanimously ruled that states could not disqualify Donald Trump from the [2024 presidential ballot](/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election), Sisson singled-out [Associate Justice](/wiki/Associate_Justice_of_the_Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States) [Clarence Thomas](/wiki/Clarence_Thomas) for attack, calling him an "insurrection sympathizer." He had previously called Thomas "one of the most corrupt pieces of garbage to ever sit on the Supreme Court." Throughout most of 2025, Sisson attacked conservative influencer [Charlie Kirk](/wiki/Charlie_Kirk), and in a June post, labeled him "a sick, racist piece of trash," and telling him to "just put the [Klan hood](/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan) on already." Following [Kirk's assassination](/wiki/Assassination_of_Charlie_Kirk) in September of that year, he described the killing as "disgusting and absolutely unacceptable." He would commend Kirk for his dedication to free speech, saying in an interview "Charlie Kirk did welcome debate from anybody," while adding that he did not think that Kirk acted in [good faith](/wiki/Good_faith). ### Media presence Sisson has been profiled in media outlets including *[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times)*, *[Vanity Fair](/wiki/Vanity_Fair_(magazine))*, *[Semafor](/wiki/Semafor_(website))*, *[The Hollywood Reporter](/wiki/The_Hollywood_Reporter)*, and [PBS NewsHour](/wiki/PBS_News_Hour). In 2023, Sisson visited the [White House](/wiki/White_House) and met with President [Joe Biden](/wiki/Joe_Biden) and Vice President [Kamala Harris](/wiki/Kamala_Harris) as part of a digital creator outreach effort. In October 2025, Sisson appeared in an AI-generated video that Donald Trump posted on his platform [Truth Social](/wiki/Truth_Social). The video depicted Trump flying a plane, dumping [feces](/wiki/Feces) over protesters at the [No Kings protests](/wiki/No_Kings_protests_(October_2025)). ## Citizenship status Sisson holds citizenship in [Ireland](/wiki/Republic_of_Ireland) and the United States. In 2024, *[The Free Press](/wiki/The_Free_Press_(newsletter))* issued a correction after it reported that Sisson was not a U.S. citizen and ineligible to vote. The publication acknowledged that Sisson is an American citizen who also holds Irish citizenship. On October 16, 2025, "Deport Harry Sisson" trended on the social media platform X, sparking debate about Sisson's citizenship status. In an X post and a TikTok post, Sisson confirmed that he holds U.S. citizenship through birth to U.S. parents abroad.
title: Harry Sisson (influencer)
